tool.name: CAMI AMBER
tool.command:
#set $path_to_html = $html.files_path
mkdir -p output inputs&&
#for $file in $binning_files: ln -s '$file' './inputs/$file.element_identifier' && #end for
amber.py -g '${gold_standard_file}' #if $label: #set $sep = '' -l ' #for $lab in $label: $sep $lab.labels #set $sep = ', ' #end for ' #end if -p ${filter} #if $min_length: -n $min_length #end if #if $desc: -d '${desc}' #end if #if $genome.min_comp: #set $sep = '' -x ' #for $min in $genome.min_comp: $sep$min.min_completeness #set $sep = ', ' #end for ' #end if #if $genome.max_cont: #set $sep = '' -y ' #for $max in $genome.max_cont: $sep$max.max_contamination #set $sep = ', ' #end for ' #end if #if $genome.remove_genomes: -r '$genome.remove_genomes' #end if #if $genome.remove.is_select == 'yes': -k '$genome.keyword' #end if #if $genome.genome_coverage: --genome_coverage '$genome.genome_coverage' #end if #if $tox.ncbi.is_select == 'yes': --ncbi_dir '$tox.ncbi_dir.fields.path' #end if -o output #for $bin in $binning_files# 'inputs/$bin.element_identifier' #end for# &&
mv './output/heatmap_bar.png' '$path_to_html'

param.name: binning_files
param.label: Input bin files here
param.help: Input all bin files which amber should use

param.label: Mapping of contigs or reads
param.help: Input the gold standard file here so amber know the correct IDs for each contig/read

repeat.name: label
repeat.title: Binning names
repeat.help: Enter muliple binning names. IMPORTANT: for each binning file you use in the program you need to state one label, this mean for example for 3 binning files you need 3 labels (3 slots) not more or less!

param.label: Filter out the n smallest genome bins
param.help: Optional filter for filter out the n smalltest genome bins

param.label: Mimimum length of sequences
param.help: Input how long the sequnces has to be

param.label: HTML description
param.help: Enter the HTML page description here

repeat.name: min_comp
repeat.title: Minimum completenes thresholds
repeat.help: Enter certain threshold for min. completeness. (Default %: 50,70,90), the program itself will transform it to %!

repeat.name: max_cont
repeat.title: Max contamination thresholds
repeat.help: Enter certain thresholds for max contamination. (Default %: 5,10), the program itself will transform it to %!

param.label: TSV file for genomes to remove
param.help: Input a TSV file with binid and type in each line. In the help section is an example. WARNING: IF THE LIST CONTAIN ALL GENOME THE PROGRAM WILL FAIL!

param.name: is_select
param.label: Remove one or all genomes which are in the list?
param.help: Select yes and enter a keyword to remove certain type of genomes which are in the list. When all genomes in the list should remove also select yes and do not enter a keyword!

param.label: Keyword for removing certain genomes
param.help: Input a keyword which should be match with binid giving in the file for removing genomes. When no keyword is giving the program remove all genomes which are in the list!

param.label: Genome coverages TSV file
param.help: Input a TSV file where the genome coverage is stated. Look at the help section to se how this file should look like!

param.name: is_select
param.label: Want to use the NCBI database?
param.help: select yes if you want to use the NCBI database from a data manager

param.label: Assessing taxonomic binning
param.help: Include the NCBI taxinimy database. For this you can use the data manager data_manager_fetch_ncbi_taxonomy which can be install via galaxy.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What is AMBER**
AMBER is an evaluation package for the comparative assessment of genome reconstructions and taxonomic assignments from metagenome benchmark datasets.
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
AMBER calculate multiple metrics per bin and multiple metrics per samlple. Each of them are provided then in results rankings, and comparative visualizations for assessing multiple programs or parameter effects.
For more information please vistit `AMBER in GitHub <https://github.com/CAMI-challenge/AMBER>`_.
**Input**
AMBER use only 2 required inputs:
- The golden standard file (tabular format)
.. class:: infomark
Example(tab seperated)
::
@Version:0.9.1 @SampleID:CAMI_low
@@SEQUENCEID BINID _LENGTH RL|S1|C10817 Sample18_57 20518 RL|S1|C11497 Sample22_57 37672 RL|S1|C6571 evo_1286_AP.033 69914 RL|S1|C10560 evo_1286_AP.033 995657 RL|S1|C13546 evo_1286_AP.033 626775
Note: This file looks similar to the binning files but the only different which is also is important is the length column.
- Muliple binning files (tabular format)
.. class:: infomark
Example(tab seperated):
::
#CAMI Format for Binning @Version:0.9.0 @SampleID:CAMI_low @@SEQUENCEID BINID RL|S1|C10 Bin_034 RL|S1|C100 Bin_023 RL|S1|C1000 Bin_034 RL|S1|C10000 Bin_019 RL|S1|C10002 Bin_035 RL|S1|C10004 Bin_035 RL|S1|C10008 Bin_034 RL|S1|C10011 Bin_035 RL|S1|C10012 Bin_013 RL|S1|C10014 Bin_035
There are also additional inputs which can be used:
- A genome list which should be removed(tabular fomrat)
.. class:: informark
Example(tab seperated):
::
evo_1035930.029 common strain 1035930 common strain evo_1035930.032 common strain evo_1035930.011 common strain evo_1286_AP.033 common strain 1286_AP common strain evo_1286_AP.026 common strain evo_1286_AP.037 common strain evo_1286_AP.008 common strain 1052944 common strain 1053058 common strain 1052947 common strain evo_1049056.013 common strain evo_1049056.031 common strain evo_1049056.011 common strain 1049056 common strain evo_1049056.039 common strain
Note: The first column contain the BINID and the second contain any kind of string. IMPORTANT: The argument where to state a keyword has to match to the anything in the second column to filter thesse kind of genomes out. If there is no keyword stated it can happen if the remove list contain all genomes which sould be used then AMBER will fail since there are no genomese left to use!
- Genome coverage file (tabular format)
.. class:: infomark
Example(tab seperated):
::
@SampleID:gsa_pooled @@GENOMEID COVERAGE 4378740.0 82.85111527272727 4378740.1 27.159305090909097 denovo10559.0 2.1596957142857143 179927.0 1.6946866666666667 denovo8373.1 2.07144 136604.0 9.150489565217391 denovo8373.0 1.1413460000000002 269378.0 8.051563333333332 190114.0 18.253119629629627 228140.0 3.078681818181818 135956.0 121.52672015625001 259846.0 12.298210588235296 162576.0 9.57867191489362 184966.0 14.461031521739134
There is also an option to include the NCBI database in AMBER. This can be used when incuding the link which is stated in the data manager: **data_manager_fetch_ncbi_taxonomy**. This data manager download the current version of the database and store all files for you. If there are questiona about data manager maybe have a look at this `Tutorial <https://usegalaxy.eu/training-material/topics/admin/tutorials/reference-genomes/tutorial.html>`_.
**Output**
AMBER will output 3 tsv files where each matrics value is stated. The important output is the HTML file where all data are included and also can be visualized with certain plots!
**Additional information**
The package **Bokeh** will create warnings whitch can be ignored since the only tell you that certain funtcions in the code are swaped with the new functions. AMBER was tested with the stated version of **Bokeh** and with the newest version of it and both generate the same output!
